FuncDef: The display interface-match-check status command displays boards or subcards that do not match the type of the previous ones.
Examples: Following boards and cards are waiting for recovering configuration because of interface-match-check:
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The interface match check function can effectively avoid the configuration failure caused by installation of inappropriate boards or subcards. After the interface match check function is enabled, the system automatically checks whether the type of the newly inserted board or subcard matches that of the previous board or subcard, if the original board or subcard is replaced by a new one. If the types are different, an alarm is generated and the newly inserted board or subcard cannot restore the previous configurations. In this case, the board is unavailable. The display interface-match-check status command displays the result of the interface match check.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
